refnamediv.refpurpose: Write an image as file in a directory from a jimage mlist

listitem.para: A mlist containing : the matrix of the image, the name, the format and encoding of the image
A character string containing the path of the directory where the image might be saved. If unpresent, the default path is the current directory's path.
A character string containing the image's format. Only 'jpg', 'png', 'gif', 'bmp' and 'wbmp' are supported. If the format isn't declared, the default format is the current format.
A character string containing the image's title. If the title isn't declared, the default name is the current name.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function save an image as a file from a mlist jimage. It can save RGB, RGBA or gray scales images.

The mlist image contain : the image matrix data, the encoding, the format and the name, of the image. The gray encoding is for 2D matrix data of gray scale images. The rgb encoding is for 3D matrix data of RGB images. The rgba encoding is for 4D matrix data of RGBA images. The last dimension stand for transparency. This list is created by the function jimread
